intro: Cullen drupaceum, commonly known as the yellow cullen, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round drupes that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
